result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Tyrone Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 02-16-2016. Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs, fees and surcharges owing; failure to pay any ordered costs, fees and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay.
Consecutive to: to any sentence. TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Tyrone Bell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court ordered defendant to serve 42 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 42 days; TIME SERVED.

- Pay DNA surcharge by 02-16-2016.
- Pay the DV surcharge by 02-16-2016.
- Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 02-16-2016.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs, fees and surcharges owing; failure to pay any ordered costs, fees or surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to defendant's inability to pay

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Steven Tyrone Bell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Steven Tyrone Bell in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court, defendant Steven Bell not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case addressed off the record, form filed. Case remains set for Plea & Sentencing with pending matters set for Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: ANGIE M, HER CHILDREN OR HER RESIDENCE.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven Tyrone Bell in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Steven Tyrone Bell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to lower pending cases ( 14CM2611, 14CM3040).  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
